title.string: モバイルの RUM データをプロキシする

attributes.content: The RUM Mobile SDKs can be configured to send requests through a proxy.
attributes.string: The RUM Mobile SDKs can be configured to send requests through a proxy.

attributes.content: To successfully forward a request to Datadog, your proxy must support
attributes.string: To successfully forward a request to Datadog, your proxy must support

attributes.content: To successfully forward a request to Datadog, your proxy must support
attributes.string: To successfully forward a request to Datadog, your proxy must support

attributes.content: When initializing the Android SDK, specify the following proxy configuration:
attributes.string: When initializing the Android SDK, specify the following proxy configuration:

attributes.content:
val configBuilder = Configuration.Builder(
    clientToken = "<client token>",
    env = "<environment>"
)

val proxy = Proxy(Proxy.Type.HTTP, InetSocketAddress("<www.example.com>", <123>))
val authenticator = ProxyAuthenticator("<proxy user>", "<proxy password>")

configBuilder.setProxy(proxy, authenticator)

val configBuilder = Configuration.Builder(
    clientToken = "<client token>",
    env = "<environment>"
)

val proxy = Proxy(Proxy.Type.HTTP, InetSocketAddress("<www.example.com>", <123>))
val authenticator = ProxyAuthenticator("<proxy user>", "<proxy password>")

configBuilder.setProxy(proxy, authenticator)
When initializing the iOS SDK, specify the following proxy configuration:
attributes.string: When initializing the iOS SDK, specify the following proxy configuration:

attributes.content:
import DatadogCore

Datadog.initialize(
  with: Datadog.Configuration(
    clientToken: "<client token>",
    env: "<environment>",
    proxyConfiguration: [
        kCFNetworkProxiesHTTPEnable: true,
        kCFNetworkProxiesHTTPPort: <123>,
        kCFNetworkProxiesHTTPProxy: "<www.example.com>",
        kCFProxyUsernameKey: "<proxy user>",
        kCFProxyPasswordKey: "<proxy password>"
    ]
  ),
  trackingConsent: trackingConsent
)

import DatadogCore

Datadog.initialize(
  with: Datadog.Configuration(
    clientToken: "<client token>",
    env: "<environment>",
    proxyConfiguration: [
        kCFNetworkProxiesHTTPEnable: true,
        kCFNetworkProxiesHTTPPort: <123>,
        kCFNetworkProxiesHTTPProxy: "<www.example.com>",
        kCFProxyUsernameKey: "<proxy user>",
        kCFProxyPasswordKey: "<proxy password>"
    ]
  ),
  trackingConsent: trackingConsent
)
When initializing the React Native SDK, specify the following proxy configuration:
